lead_paragraph: The lawyer for Thomas W. Libous, a former top New York State senator, has moved to have his late client’s corruption conviction vacated based on the doctrine known as abatement by death.

headline.print_headline: Obscure Legal Doctrine May Erase Guilty Verdict for Dead Ex-Legislator
headline.main: Obscure Legal Doctrine May Erase Guilty Verdict for Ex-Legislator Who Died

snippet: The lawyer for Thomas W. Libous, a former top New York State senator, has moved to have his late client’s corruption conviction vacated based on the doctrine known as abatement by death....
abstract: Lawyer for late New York State Sen Thomas W Libous files papers in United States Court of appeals to have Libous's 2015 perjury convictions vacated and his indictment dismissed under legal doctrine of abatement by death; Libous, who died in 2016 and who always maintained his innocence, was convicted of lying to FBI agents about bribery and fraud scheme.
